3: How did it end?
The way it should. The betrayer becomes betrayed, dying in the dream that is his childhood.
Shome's end will be a good wake-up call to his like.
Looks like everything's going our way.
So why don't you look happy?
Huh?
Luna blanks out shortly from Alpha's words. As if realizing the unusual expression she is wearing, she quickly adjusts and returns to normal.
It's nothing.
It's okay. Tell me when you feel like it.
...Yeah.
Anyways... Now that that's over, what next?

At Alpha's question, Luna lowers her head in thought. Alpha stands by her in wait, glancing at the surrounding scenery. The sea breeze blows in the scent of summer, rustling the coconut trees on the beach.
If the next step's not decided yet... Why not relax a little here?
Yay...! A million yays...!
Lamia suddenly emerges from the sea and claps her hands excitedly. She claps a scant few times before freezing when she realizes Alpha's blade is on her neck.
Eep—
Wasn't asking you.
And I've warned you. Don't go invisible around me. Read the room before you pop out.
Sorry! I'll be careful next time!
I've heard that more than enough. Looks like you need a few broken legs to remember.
Eeeep!
Lamia struggles, desperately, even stealing glances at Luna in plea for help. Seeing the two, a light chirp escapes Luna's lips.
(Chuckles)
Alpha and Lamia pause at Luna's laugh. Luna shakes her head and speaks.
If you say so, Sis. Then let's take a rest.
...We'll rest all that we can before the Babylonia reinforcements arrive.

The summer heat did not falter even at night. The night breeze, brought over by the sea, is a wave of turgid humidity. Unpleasant though it may be, it does nothing to damper the enthusiasm of those at the beach.
The crowd from Babylonia are holding a grand celebration on the beach. In contrast, the walkway is cold and empty.
Footfalls pitter and patter from one end of the walkway, infusing this desolate street with a hint of liveliness.
Finally... I get to relax a little...
Finally? I don't see any difference from your usual self.
Um... At least there's no missions or work stuff! Mentally, I get to relax!
...But, there'll be work after this break... Noooo, cruel world... Despair...
Is your emotion module working fine?
Lamia's stats are normal!
...Why can't we be like the people in the poster over there, relaxing on the beach in our swimsuits with snacks in our hands?
Doing nothing... Thinking about nothing... No despair, no nothing...
Why are you staring at us?
Lamia goes from gabbling to silence, staring at Luna and Alpha.
I'm imagining you both on the beach in swimsuits. The thought itself scares me, so forget it.
Aaaaa... Come to think of it, even swimsuits are meaningless for us... I guess... swimsuits are only destined for cute little humans...
Should we set off some fireworks?
I mean... there's no point. But yes.

Alpha interrupts the Lamia radiating with negativity by thrusting her a bundle of fireworks she found somewhere. Lamia receives the fireworks, raising them like a flag as she slithers toward the beach.
Let's go have a look at that store over there.
Did you see something you want?
Yeah.
Alpha nods, and brings Luna to one of the stores along the pedestrian walkway.
The inside of the shop is a practical Shark-speare paradise. Shark-speare plushies, Shark-speare ads, and more. A big sign, hanging in front of the store counter, reads: Opening sale, 70% off.
Looks like a place that sells shark souvenirs.
Not just sharks. Look at this.
As Alpha speaks, she filches out a mini frog plushie from behind a pile of Shark-speare plushies and hands it to Luna.
Why is this everywhere?
Not a bad thing, though?
Well, since you're giving me a souvenir, I'll pick something for you too.
It's oka... Alright.
How's this?
Nothing. It's just a piece of clothing.
I think it looks nice on you.
As long as you like it.
Sis, if we can return to being Constructs, what would you do?
Same thing right now. Whatever happens, I will still be by your side. That's all.
Besides, there's no what-ifs in this world.

Alpha replies to Luna's sudden question without much thought, but it draws out a long silence from Luna. Alpha stops in her tracks when she realizes Luna is behind, staring at her with a stern expression.
What if there are?
...You mean Shome's research?
...Yeah.
Shome only saw one side of his research, but there is another side that no one's noticed.
At the end on that other side lies the true 'origin.'

A gust of sea breeze washes over. The stifling heat seems to be finally dying down. The night is now carrying a hint of chilling cold instead. Luna raises her head to look at the Alpha beside her and speaks.
I'm a little tired, Sis.
Let's go sit over there.
Holding Luna's hand, Alpha sits down on a bench next to the pedestrian walkway with Luna. Luna leans her head on Alpha's shoulder and closes her eyes.
Strange sounds travel over from the beach. Looking at where it came from, Alpha discovers several Corrupted on the beach banging on musical instruments.
...Preset performances?
...A bit too rowdy.
I'll be right back.
Alpha draws her weapon and zips toward the Corrupted on the beach.
